turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Women's rights in Nepal.
turn.1: What are some of the health issues faced by women in Nepal?
turn.2: Because of the inadequate provision of healthcare for pregnant mothers, they are more susceptible to death during the course of pregnancy and during labor itself.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: According to the Nepal Demographic and Health Survey (NDHS) 2001, about 10% of all births are carried out in the presence of a qualified doctor or medical staff.
turn.5: Is there any reason why this may happen?
turn.6: This reflects the prevalence of home births, around 81% of all births, in Nepalese society.
turn.7: What else did you find interesting?
turn.8: Due to the cultural beliefs, women are generally reluctant to allow any outsiders to be present or attend to the birth.
turn.9: Is there any other issues affecting women?
turn.10: Geography has also greatly limited the availability of health services especially those in rural and mountainous regions.
turn.11: What are some of the problems they face?
turn.12: Even though there has been much road development in recent years, females are less impacted by it, as they remain infrequent road users.
